text: Vasily Fomich Sharangovich (; , Vasil Sharanhovich; 1897–1938) was Belarusian Soviet politician and first secretary of the Byelorussian SSR in the Soviet Union. He was executed after the last of the Moscow Trials, the Trial of the Twenty-One, in 1938. Sharangovich was rehabilitated in 1958.http://www.hrono.ru/biograf/bio_sh/sharangovich.php ==References== Category:1897 births Category:1938 deaths Category:People from Myadzyel District Category:People from Vileysky Uyezd Category:Heads of the Communist Party of Byelorussia Category:Case of the Anti-Soviet "Bloc of Rightists and Trotskyites" Category:Great Purge victims from Belarus Category:Belarusian people executed by the Soviet Union
title: Vasily Sharangovich
